title: Everton's Romelu Lukaku offering guidance to Belgium starlet Youri Tielemans as he contemplates potential move
text:

Everton are hoping Romelu Lukaku’s relationship with Youri Tielemans will put them in pole position for the highly-rated Belgian starlet this summer. 
Tielemans is one of the shining lights in Belgian football, having come through the system at Anderlecht, and speculation is growing that he could move on this summer. 
At the weekend, Tielemans scored two stunners in a 4-1 away win at KV Oostende, showcasing his talent with a long-range effort off either foot. 
And those efforts came after the Anderlecht skipper had been given a Friday night pep talk by mentor Lukaku. Tielemans is skippering Anderlecht at 19 (Photo: Photonews) 
Tielemans broke into the Anderlecht side in 2013, at the age of 16. He's now in his fourth season in the Belgian top flight, having twice won the country’s Young Player of the Year award. 
The Premier League's leading goalscorer is friends with the 19-year-old through his brother, Jordan, who was a teammate of Tielemans until joining Lazio last summer. 
And the two have grown closer since Belgium boss Roberto Martinez handed Tielemans his senior debut for the national team in November, where he was taken under the wing of Toffees hitman Lukaku. 
Lukaku has revealed he offered Tielemans further advice on Friday night while back in his homeland with family, before travelling to Ostende to witness the youngster's magnificent weekend double. Lukaku and Tielemans are close (Photo: Getty) Tielemans scored twice for Anderlecht and is now eyeing the exit (Photo: Photonews) 
“I told him he needed to continue and score lots of goals,” Lukaku told Voo Foot after watching his former club’s win in the stands, alongside his brother. 
"If he manages it, he’ll have a magnificent future. He’s growing on the pitch, and he’s decisive. It’s exactly what he needs to do. 
"I think he’s ready to go up a level in his career. He already had his passing and his leadership, now he has goals. 
"We’d already talked about it on international duty, and he’s carried on since. I’m really happy for him." 
It comes after Tielemans last week agreed with the suggestion that a move to a club like Everton is the next step in his career. 
Scouts from a host of Europe’s biggest clubs have visited the Constant Vanden Stock to check up on the midfielder over the last 18 months. 
But on RTBF radio show La Tribune , in a conversation with ex-Belgium international Marc Degryse, it was put to Tielemans that a club such as the Merseysiders - a side not considered a powerhouse, but in a major league - is his next logical step. 
“It’s what’s best to progress step by step," agreed the playmaker. "What Mark says, it’s good to not burn steps and to avoid ending up on the bench and not getting game time. It’s what’s best for every footballer, I think.” poll loading Which Youri Tielemans goal was better? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
